economyPage.title: Shared Prosperity in the Giving Economy

income.title: Raha Basic Income (RBI)
income.text: Verified Raha members receive a Raha Basic Income that is currently 10 Raha points per week. To receive your RBI, you must claim it; you can accrue at most 4 weeks of unclaimed basic income at a time.

inactive.title: Inactivity Donations
inactive.text: If you do not issue any transactions for 400 days, your account will be marked as inactive. Until you send another transaction or your account balance runs out, 1% of your balance when your account became inactive will automatically be donated every day to the Raha Basic Income fund.

transactions.title: Transaction Donations
transactions.text: Instead of transaction fees, the Raha Network encourages optional donations of 3% of each transaction received to help fund the Raha Basic Income. For verified members, there are no required sender fees for the first 20 transactions a day. After that, all transactions you send will incur a fee of 0.01 Raha points.

invite.title: Invite Bonus
invite.text: While the Raha Network is small, you may instantly claim 6 weeks of basic income for each new verified member you refer, up to a maximum of 150 members. The Raha Parliament will likely change this bonus amount frequently, and it may one day go to 0.

parliamentFund.title: Parliament Fund
parliamentFund.text1: 80% of all Raha points distributed from the Raha Basic Income fund goes directly to verified members, and 20% goes to the member-elected Raha Parliament to fund the long-term growth of the Raha Network.
parliamentFund.text2: The Raha Parliament fund can only be spent after approving a budget, and no budget can be approved until the Raha Parliament exists. The Raha Parliament will not exist until voting has been implemented and its constitution has been written. All spending will be completely transparent via the immutable and distributed Raha audit log.

tenBillion.title: Ten Billion Units (TBU)
tenBillion.text1: In the Raha blockchain, there are ten billion units of the base currency total. This base Raha token is known as TBU, and internally, your balance will be stored in terms of TBUs. Initially, all the currency belongs to the Raha Basic Income fund, and shall be distributed to verified members via the basic income over time.
tenBillion.text2: On the other hand, Raha points are the user-facing denomination of TBUs, and the way your balance is displayed in the app. As the value of TBU changes, the Raha Parliament may change the exchange rate between TBUs and Raha points so that typical Raha transactions transfer intuitively reasonable quantities of Raha points.
tenBillion.text3: The current exchange rate between TBU and Raha points is 1:1.

governmentPage.title: Empowering All Members with the Raha Parliament

parliament.title: Raha Parliament
parliament.text1: The Raha Network will evolve over time, based on the decisions of the member-elected Raha Parliament. The Raha Parliament has two main responsibilities: changing network parameters, and approving budgets.
parliament.text2: For instance, over time the Raha Parliament will have to lower the quantity of TBUs distributed via the Raha Basic Income to prevent the Raha Basic Income fund from running out, as there are only ten billion units. The good news is that because of Metcalfeâ€™s Law, more members means a much more valuable network. Even as the basic income decreases in amount, it will likely increase in market value.
parliament.text3: The Raha Parliament will be elected by members of Raha, but the voting system and mechanisms are still under consideration.
parliament.participate: Help design the Raha voting system on our Discourse forum.

parliamentBudget.title: Parliament Budget
parliamentBudget.text: An example budget for how the Raha Parliament's 20% allotment from the Raha Basic Income fund might be spent is listed below.
parliamentBudget.participate: Engage on the Raha Discourse forum
parliamentBudget.participateReason: to advocate for your ideas for the budget, or lay the groundwork for an election campaign so you can join the Raha Parliament and approve budgets yourself!
parliamentBudget.point1: 5% for expanding the network to underrepresented demographics in the Raha network.
parliamentBudget.point2: 5% to expanding the Raha marketplace and establishing partnership programs to grow Raha adoption.
parliamentBudget.point3: 5% Raha Network software development, maintenance, and server costs.
parliamentBudget.point4: 5% towards building an endowment to help stabilize the market value of Raha.
